title: Riot Merchandise price
body:
Hey guys! 
So I'm Australian, and I have recently caught my eye on the new "Championship Thresh" figure from the Riot store. It says it's 30 U.S dollars, but does that mean we have to pay that currency ($42.50 here) or actual $30 AU currency? I got a little bit confused as it is the OCE merch site and the currency is in U.S dollars. Also, paying $42.50 is a little pricy for a statue that size. I don't even think that covers shipping bills... 

Please tell me! I wanna decide if I'm going to buy that statue.

replies.body: Shipping is $10 by the way. It's in US dollars, you can tell because in the right hand top corner it has "US$"
So it's $52 dollars for a little statue... Rip off dude! Those POP figure you get from EB games are almost as good quality and are $10-15... And there about the same size and quality!

Lets not forget it comes with a limited edition Championship Thresh skin worth around $10. Pop Vinyl's are actually AU $18. So taking that into account;

52 - 10 = 42 (for the skin)

42 - 10 = 32 (it's unfair to include shipping, since Pop Vinyls would also cost this much to ship)

So the actual Thresh figure is worth $32. that's $14 more than a Pop Vinyl. You can consider the extra price for, scarcity (due to it being available for a limited time), the fact that it's Thresh and that the Thresh figure is 0.75 inches taller than your average Pop Vinyl. 

That's the price of intellectual property :D

Well I never said I order my POP figures online :p, plus they are actually $15 here, 10 when they go on sale (Christmas, big sale etc...) 
Also, shipping still does count, you still paying for shipping, which adds onto the statues price!

Maybe your store is more generous with their prices but [here](https://ebgames.com.au/loot-204499-Guardians-of-the-Galaxy---Dancing-Groot-Pop-Vinyl-Bobble-Head-Figure-Loot) it has a standard AU$18 price. It doesn't matter if you order them on-line or not, since Thresh is only available on-line we need to make a direct comparison. If you wish you could fly to Riot Merchandise HQ in California and I'm sure they'll sell you a Thresh figure minus the shipping.

If you ordered a Pop Vinyl from America it would also be $10 shipping, it's unfair to complain about shipping just because it's not available in stores here.
